sn12.49:4.2: “Mendicants, a learned noble disciple doesn’t think:
sn12.49:4.4: ‘When what exists, what is? Due to the arising of what, what arises?
sn12.49:4.5: When what exists does name and form come to be? What what exists do the six sense fields … contact … feeling … craving … grasping … future existence … rebirth … old age and death come to be?’
sn12.49:5.1: Rather, a learned noble disciple has only knowledge about this that is independent of others:
sn12.49:5.2: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
sn12.49:5.5: When consciousness exists name and form comes to be.
sn12.49:5.6: When name and form exists the six sense fields come to be.
sn12.49:5.7: When the six sense fields exist contact comes to be.
sn12.49:5.8: When contact exists feeling comes to be.
sn12.49:5.9: When feeling exists craving comes to be.
sn12.49:5.10: When craving exists grasping comes to be.
sn12.49:5.11: When grasping exists future existence comes to be.
sn12.49:5.12: When future existence exists rebirth comes to be.
sn12.49:5.13: When rebirth exists old age and death come to be.’
sn12.49:5.15: ‘This is the origin of the world.’
sn12.49:6.1: A learned noble disciple doesn’t think:
sn12.49:6.3: ‘When what doesn’t exist, what is not? Due to the cessation of what, what ceases?
sn12.49:6.4: When what doesn’t exist does name and form not come to be? When what doesn’t exist do the six sense fields … contact … feeling … craving … grasping … future existence … rebirth … old age and death not come to be?’
sn12.49:7.1: Rather, a learned noble disciple has only knowledge about this that is independent of others:
sn12.49:7.2: ‘When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases.
sn12.49:7.5: When consciousness doesn’t exist name and form doesn’t come to be.
sn12.49:7.6: When name and form doesn’t exist the six sense fields don’t come to be. …
sn12.49:7.7: future existence doesn’t come to be …
sn12.49:7.9: When rebirth doesn’t exist old age and death don’t come to be.’
sn12.49:7.11: ‘This is the cessation of the world.’
sn12.49:8.1: A noble disciple comes to understand the world, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation. Such a noble disciple is called ‘one accomplished in view’, ‘one accomplished in vision’, ‘one who has come to the true teaching’, ‘one who sees this true teaching’, ‘one endowed with a trainee’s knowledge’, ‘one who has entered the stream of the teaching’, ‘a noble one with penetrative vision’, and ‘one who stands knocking at the door of the deathless’.”
